Author: cecco_
Content: The type of `args` changed to be an array. so `args: { player: account }` becomes `args: [account]`. Also notice that like you said the value of account is undefined, so the library will try to call the contract with args `[undefined]`, which will result in an error. The solution is to change it to `args: account ? [account] : undefined`, when `args` are undefined the library will not call the contract. Once the user connects, the value of account is updated and the library will finally make the request.

Content:
Hello, quick update some might be interested in! Starknet-js 3.19 is not compatible with 3.18. The rule for `starknet` in your `package.json` is `^3.10` so the move to the `latest` on starknet-js tag to 4.4.2 should not have impacted your code.... except that it has.

Content:
Finally got it to work for my contract. Doing pull request to add changes to starknet-react for a developer branch, but it may be a bit before ready. I think this will work if you want to try it now:
1) Install pre-release version (develop branch) of starknet.js which includes the updates for testnet2: $ yarn install starknet@next
2) In node_modules/@starknet-react/core/src/network.ts, inside `const KNOWN_CHAINS:` add this:
```
    [StarknetChainId.TESTNET2]: {
        id: StarknetChainId.TESTNET2,
        name: 'StarkNet G√∂rli 2',
        blockExplorer: {
            name: 'Voyager',
            url: 'https://goerli-2.voyager.online',
        },
    }
```
3)    In your _app.tsx add this line:
```
const provider = new SequencerProvider({ network: "goerli-alpha-2" })
```
